intro: Acrophorus parkeri, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its milky sap, which is toxic and can cause skin irritation. The plant typically grows to a height of about 2 meters, featuring smooth, greyish bark and oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often greenish-yellow in color, and it produces distinctive, spiny fruits that contain a single seed. Acrophorus parkeri is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient plant in harsh conditions.
